fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Users are able to log work in the old Issue Details View and now, it is no longer possible in the new UI.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to log work in new Issue Details View
fields.summary: Ability to log work in new Issue Details View

fields.description:
In the old version of JIRA we created one filter for each member of the team (Especially useful during the daily synchronize).

The new version already has an Assignee filter (Thanks for that!) but the selection is not saved in any way. Every time the page is reloaded the filter is deselected.

Can this option be saved?

 

Thanks very much!
fields.summary: Boards do not save Assignee filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary

This bug is affecting New JIRA Experience. From the Active Sprint page, dragging the issues beyond the extent of the columns will distort the column headers (the header columns will not stay) and make the drop region not functioning

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Activate 'Experience the New JIRA'
# Go to Boards > Active Sprints
# Drag one of the issues from one column to outside the column (beyond the extent of the columns)
# Observe how to column header behave
# Drop the issues in one of the columns

h3. Expected Results

The column header will stay put and the issue can be dropped in the desired column

h3. Actual Results

The column header does not stay out (it will be distored and not aligned with the column). The issue cannot be dropped successfully
fields.summary: In New JIRA Experience Active Sprint, dragging the issues beyond the extent of the sprint columns will make the column header distorted and make the drop regions not functioning

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When in Active Sprint view of a board, right click on an issue no longer presents option to move issue to a future planned sprint

h3. Environment
* In current versions of Jira Cloud
* Same problem occurs in both new interface and old interface

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to an existing scrum board that contains both an active sprint and at least one future planned sprint
# On the active sprint view of this board, right click on an issue in the sprint

h3. Expected Results
Would expect to see an options such as "Remove from Sprint" and "Send to backlog"
 !right-click-context-menu.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Actual Results
Only allows you to send to top or bottom of the swimlane.
 !rightclickmenu1.png|thumbnail! 


 
h3. Notes
There does not appear to be any mention of this feature having been removed from this view in the [What's New notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/what-s-new-686863216.html#What%27sNew-jirasoftware].  However, you can see this functionality did exist at least in this Dec 2016 blog post about this issue: [New design of JIRA Software issue cards - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/blog/2016/12/new-design-of-jira-software-issue-cards]

h3.Workaround
If you jump over to the Backlog view, a right click on an issue there still allows you to send the issue to a future sprint, to move to top of backlog, or to bottom of backlog.
fields.summary: When in Active Sprint view of a board, right click on an issue no longer presents option to move issue to a future planned sprint

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Converting an issue from any issue type to Epic doesn't require the addition of the Epic Name field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue from any issue type
# Open the issue type dropdown on the issue detail view and select Epic
!conver.png|thumbnail! 
# Create an issue inside the Epic

h3. Expected Results

While changing the issue type to Epic there should be a popup to fill the Epic Name for the issue as it's currently working when moving the issue.

h3. Actual Results

The issues is changed to Epic and the child issues receive the Epic Link unlabelled-{issue key}
!child.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

Edit the issue manually and add the Epic Name value.
!edit.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Converting issues to Epics leaves the Epic Name field without a value

fields.description:
I/ We would like to see or have the possibility to change the GUI layout, so that it directly shows Assignee in the overview. This makes it easier and quicker to directly find the Operator which has to make move so that the test cycle can continue.

If this Suggestion applies i would be happy about a notice to my E-Mail adress. Thank you very much.
fields.summary: programm Laout Optimisation

fields.description:
We have a relatively new board we are using to track our ticket progress within Jira. For the most part, all our tickets have been tracked and managed efficiently the last sprint and a half. This morning, 3 tickets were not showing up, but the rest of our tickets are still fine.

The filter query to know which tickets to pull in is very simple; it based on Labels, and we only have 3 possible labels within the query (Alpha, alpha, ALPHA).

Outside of that, we have the proper sprint assigned to these 3 tickets, as well as a status that should be recognized by our status filters. As Scrum Master, I have reviewed these 3 tickets with our Team Lead and Dev Manager, but we can't figure out how/why they aren't still showing up.

When we look at the sprint container in our backlog, all of the tickets are accounted for.

I will attach a few images showing the tickets in backlog, vs what is on our board.
fields.summary: Tickets With Proper Status/Sprint/Label Are Not Showing On Sprint Board

h3. Problem Definition

Users have noticed that the backlog page has a large number of requests made. Due to the fact that a browser agent can only process 4 requests concurrently, this can lead to longer than average load times.

h3. Suggested Solution

Update scripts on Backlog page to remove deprecated items / clean up the requests
Look in to deep refactoring of main project board page/Backlog view

h3. Why this is important

The backlog view is a heavily utilized page which teams use for meetings to prepare for sprints. A user has estimated that up to a combined hour of time is spent by all team members waiting due to the additional time the backlog takes to load each day.

Converting issues currently in a Sprint to sub-task whose parent is in a different Sprint or no Sprint at all, causes a bug in which the sub-task issue will still display as if it belongs to the old Sprint (not the parent one).

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
h4. Scenario 1
# Create a standard issue in a Sprint
# Convert this issue to a sub-task whose parent is in a different Sprint or have no sprint at all.

h4. Scenario 2
# Create a sub-task issue in a Sprint
# Convert this sub-task to a standard task and put in a different Sprint from the parent.

h3. Expected Results
The issue should be displayed under the parent's sprint, or in the correct Sprint, depending the case.

h3. Actual Results
The issue is displayed in the old incorrect Sprint, not respecting the current parent sprint.

h3. Notes
First report: Oct-11-2017
In some cases clicking on the *View on Board* link on affected issues will give the user "Page unavailable".

h3.Workaround
None for now.

fields.description:
Hi Guys,

Requirement - I need exactly this in JIRA for my teams board, a request form so other people can fill it out and I can then decide whether I put it in to the backlog as a story or not.

At the minute this is either done by requesting via email as they send their requirements, but this is obviously hard to track and means nothing if the PO then changes as they will no longer have access to this, or people just add stories randomly into the backlog but in a different fashion and without a prioirty and then it will get lost or it will be a duplicate.

Having the request part will allow for discussion to take place, will allow for it to be tracked through JIRA, and it will also allow for other teams to look at what has been requested to avoid duplication or see that it has already been requested and can see what the decision was when it was requested. 

Maybe having an "accept/decline" of a request that then attaches to the story once it is written, with the declined request staying visible somewhere so it can be viewed in future in case there is a duplicate request etc.

This should hopefully save time searching through emails and repeatedly telling people the same answer because of multiple requests for the same thing.

Thanks,

Tom

fields.description:
h3. Summary
_Story points_ are not shown on card layout. Also, filters with _Story points_ have no results.

h3. Environment
JIRA Software Cloud backlog

h3. Expected Results
_Story Points_ are shown on card layout and searches return results.

h3. Actual Results
_Story Points_ are not shown.

h3. Troubleshooting Notes
The Story Points field requires a searcher to be indexed and displayed on search results. Search Template for Story Points custom field should be "Number searcher". Make sure that the field has that configuration via JIRA Admin > Issues > Custom Fields > Story Points -> Edit page.

h3. Workaround
For the board issue, it's possible to add the field _Story Points_ to the card layout.

For the JQL, try:
- Go to Custom Fields section
- Click on the cog next to the custom field and select _Configure_
- Edit the context > save the changes
- Change back the settings of the context > save the changes
fields.summary: Story points are not shown on card layout

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, as explained in [Using Manage Sprints permission for advanced cases|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/using-manage-sprints-permission-for-advanced-cases-800708249.html]:
{quote}
*When boards have complex filter queries*
A filter query is considered complex when Jira Software can't determine which projects will be returned by the query. When this happens, Jira Software will require users to have the 'Manage Sprints' permission for all projects in the instance — essentially, you'll need to manually set users to have this permission for all projects.
{quote}

This means that the users also need to have *Manage Sprints* permission in the JIRA Service Desk projects as well as have JIRA Service Desk licence. 
*  !Manage Sprint permision in a JSD project.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Suggested Solution
Improve *Manage Sprint* permissions when the filter is complex, so that the user doesn't also needs a Service Desk licence.
fields.summary: Improve 'Manage Sprint' permissions when the filter is complex

fields.description:
Subtasks do not have the same lifecycle as user stories. So it stands to reason that the statuses for a subtasks will not always be the same as for user stories.

However JIRA won't let me close a sprint unless the subtasks of user stories have a status that's the same as one of the statuses of the user story itself.

For example, say I have a user story workflow of Ready | In Progress | Ready for QA | In QA | In Review | Done. That's fine.

Then say I create a subtask workflow of To Do | In Progress | Approved | Closed.

If I have any stories which have subtasks in a state of "Approved" or "Closed," JIRA will not allow me to close the sprint. Instead I get the message,  "Sprint cannot be completed as there are incomplete subtasks on the following issues:"

This is bizarre. Why allow people to modify workflows for different issue types and subtypes if this then prevents the valid closing of a sprint?
fields.summary: Cannot close a sprint with subtasks in a state other than parent story states

fields.description:
Hello Atlassian,

Specifically, this deals with a known issue here: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Is-there-a-way-of-adding-Issue-links-as-a-column-in-JIRA-issue/qaq-p/266975

I want to add a little bit to this and see where you stand on this missing functionality. Let's get right into the issue here...

When creating an issue in JIRA, LINKED ISSUES is available. This allows for an issue to link to JIRA tickets only. It is one-third of the functionality of the LINK modal window. But that's fine...

Once you either link a JIRA issue in a Confluence page, or add a linked JIRA issue in the originating JIRA issue, you now have "Issue Links" as a field. This modal allows linking JIRA issues, Confluence pages, and External URLs.

What appears to be *full functionality* only exists when you have made a JIRA-JIRA, or Confluence-to-JIRA link. Am I missing something? All I want to do is expose the [ + ] functionality of "Issue Links" without having to create a false linkage. Specifically, I want to link to Confluence and External URLs without having to create a dummy JIRA link first.

Am I missing something?

-Mat
fields.summary: Create Issue Link without creating a dummy first

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When moving a story that has an Epic Link to another project JIRA lets you transform it to an Epic issue type and the Epic Link field is not cleaned.

It also impacts next-gen projects, when we move a Story from a Classic project to a Next-gen project, the Story keeps the Epic link, letting the user associate the Story with a new Epic via parent link, and as consequence, the Story can have two Epics.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two projects
 # Create an Epic in Project
 # Create a story associated with that same Epic
 # Move the story to the second project changing its type to Epic

h3. Expected Results

JIRA shouldn't let you select the issue type Epic when moving a Story with an existing Epic Link as this leads to an Epic being the son of another Epic which is an inconsistency in the relationship system of JIRA issues.
 Another option is removing the value from Epic Link when the issue type is updated.
h3. Actual Results

JIRA transforms the issue to an Epic and keeps the Epic Link causing an inconsistency on the issues hierarchy.
 !epic.png|thumbnail! 
 !story.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

For issue type changed:
 # Change the issue type back to the original issue type.
 # Remove the Epic link.
 # Change the issue type back to the desired issue type.

For issues moved between projects:
 # Move the issue back to the classic project.
 # Remove the Epic link.
 # Move the issue back to the original project.

For issues where even the Epic link is blank but the hierarchy is still not correct:
# Move the issue back to Story type
# Change again to the Epic issue type.
fields.summary: Move or change the issue type of a Story does not clear the Epic link.

h3. Summary

Related board isn't shown in "Board in this project" if it contains multiple projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Create a filter to include the above 3 projects
 # Create a new board based on that filter and select one of the projects as board location (ie project A)
 # Attempt to access the board from _Boards -> View All Boards_

h3. Actual Result

It is redirected to below URL and no related boards shown.
 - https://<instance URL>/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=<board ID>
 - !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Result

It should redirect to below URL and all related board is shown.
 - https://<instance URL>/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=<board ID>&projectKey=<selected project key>

h3. Workaround

Use the "New Jira Experience" which is available via your profile menu when you click on the arrow next to your avatar in the header.

This issue does not exist in the New Jira Experience as the board location is used to determine which boards get shown for any given project. 
h3. Notes

It works as expected when users navigate to _Projects -> select the project location_

h3. Summary
* Quick filter does not stay applied after navigating to board via the Home Logo
* Only occurs when home page is set to and Agile Board. The board's quick filter is not applied to the board when selecting the top left logo 

h3. Environment
* JIRA Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create new Software Project in Cloud instance
# Create a Kanban Board and a few example issues with different owners
# Make sure your JIRA Home Page the same board: [KB here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/changing-your-jira-home-page-720416089.html]
# Using the default Quick Filters > Click on Only My Issues
# The filter is selected and applied correctly
# Hit the Atlassian Logo and it reloads the board > The quick filter is still selected but you can see that it is not applied to the issues below
# No errors the Developer tool in Chrome

h3. Notes

* Strange behavior when filter is not applied correctly: If you click outside the current browser tab and then click the tab once again the page reloads and the board filter that was selected is now applied
* Can be replicate 100% of the time on Cloud instance

h3.Workaround
* Select Quick Filter to disable filter and click again to reapply
* Click outside the current tab and the select the tab once again. The board will refresh and the filter will be applied

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Jira Bitbucket Importer plugin has been removed for the time being in the new infrastructure as the most of the other external importers. However, this is still documented for JIRA Cloud in the below documentation page:
- [Importing data from Bitbucket|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-bitbucket-935384618.html]



h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud, new infrastructure. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In JIRA Administration go to *External System Import*


h3. Expected Results
The Bitbucket importer is there

h3. Actual Results
There is no BitBucket importer. Only importers for CSV, JSON and Trello.  


h3.Workaround


At this current point in time the below workarounds are not working anymore:
{quote} # A simple JSON to CSV converter does not work. You have to re-format the data using something like the [https://bitbucket.org/Enharmonic/bitbucket-to-jira-issue-conversion] tool (that is outdated and not supported).
 # Download and install a test JIRA Server (latest version) locally. Use the native BB importer to import the issues in there. Follow the steps in below KB to merge the 2 instances together (since you only have 1 Cloud instance you can skip step #1 of the KB):
 -- [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-merge-two-different-jira-cloud-applications-together-779160767.html]{quote}
Point #2 is not working at the moment due to another open bug introduced in Jira Server 7.13: JRASERVER-69595 

Therefore, what can be done while waiting for the above bug to be fixed is the following:
 # Install a staging Jira Server using the [latest 7.12 release available for download (7.12.3)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracore/jira-core-7-12-x-release-notes-955179462.html]
 # Use external system import to import the issues from Bitbucket Cloud into Jira Server
 # Once the issue are imported, depending on your needs, you can either:
 -- Export the issues to CSV and import them in Jira Cloud. See [Importing data from CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-csv-776636762.html] and [Creating issues using the CSV importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-765593817.html] for details.
 -- Upgrade Jira to latest 7.13 version then use the [Jira Cloud Migration Assistant|https://www.atlassian.com/cloud-migration/jcma] to import the issues in Cloud (Still EAP. Only available to customers that ask for it at the moment. For details see: [About the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant early access program|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Migrations-Early-Access/About-the-Jira-Cloud-Migration-Assistant-early-access-program/gpm-p/1165638]
 -- Upgrade to a more recent Jira version (or latest) and follow the steps in the KB [Merge multiple instances of Jira Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/merge-multiple-instances-of-jira-cloud-779160767.html] as explained in previous workaround.
fields.summary: The "Importing data from Bitbucket" documentation page refers to functionalities that are not existing in the new infrastructure

h3. Issue Summary
Issues are closed within a sprint but the reports show them under different sprints.
This happens when there are multiple active sprints. Issues will be listed under the most recent sprint.

h3. Environment
This issue affects the reports *Release burndown* and *Epic burndown*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Scrum project
 # Create version _1.0_
 # Create _Issue 1_
 # Create _Issue 2_
 # Add _story points_ to the created issues
 # Move issues to version
 # Create sprint _RBR Sprint 1_
 # Create sprint _RBR Sprint 2_
 # Move _Issue 1_ to sprint _RBR Sprint 1_
 # Move _Issue 2_ to sprint _RBR Sprint 2_
